Settings.Name: Add Vore Items
Settings.Description: Adds vore-enabling items to the currently controlled character

Settings.Name: Boiling Insides Fast Digestion
Settings.Description: Dead prey are digested twice as fast if you have 'Boiling insides' feat.

Settings.Name: Digestion Rate (Long Rest)
Settings.Description: Determines by how much the weight of a prey who is being digested is reduced after a long rest

Settings.Name: Digestion Rate (Short Rest)
Settings.Description: Determines by how much the weight of a prey who is being digested is reduced after each short rest

Settings.Name: Gradual Digestion Amount
Settings.Description: You will passively digest dead prey by this much per X turns (set with Gradual Digestion Turns option). Set to 0 to disable.

Settings.Name: Gradual Digestion Turns
Settings.Description: How often passive digestion happens. 1 turn = 6 real seconds. Set to 0 to disable.

Settings.Name: Instant Digestion
Settings.Description: If true, you lose weight immediately upon finishing digestion, and you will be immediately able to absorb / dispose of prey

Settings.Name: Hunger
Settings.Description:
Enables hunger system for party member preds. If a pred does not digest prey for a long time, they will receive debuffs.
Setting this to false disables hunger completely.

Settings.Name: Hungry Stacks
Settings.Description: Stacks of hunger at which you are hungry.

Settings.Name: Famished Stacks
Settings.Description: Stacks of hunger at which you are extremely hungry.

Settings.Name: Starving Stacks
Settings.Description: Stacks of hunger at which you are desperately hungry.

Settings.Name: Hunger Stacks (Long Rest)
Settings.Description: Hunger stacks gained on long rest.

Settings.Name: Satiation
Settings.Description: The amount of satiation required to reduce your hunger by 1 stack. A bigger value means you require more prey to sastiate your hunger.

Settings.Name: Digestion Efficiency
Settings.Description: How much satiation you get from digestion. This number is a percentage of the value of Digestion Rate (Long Rest)

Settings.Name: Hunger Stacks (Short Rest)
Settings.Description: Hunger stacks gained on short rest.

Settings.Name: Accidental Digestion
Settings.Description:
If set to true, as you gain Hunger, it will become increasingly likely that you'll accidentally start digesting your non-lethally swallowed prey.
Works independently from SwitchEndoLethal.

Settings.Name: Allow Overstuffing (WIP)
Settings.Description:
If true, devouring prey can push you over your maximum carrying capacity, but you'll take damage every round proportional to how overstuffed you are.
If false, you'll be hard-capped by your carrying capacity.

Settings.Name: Feats Add Loci
Settings.Description: If true, certain feats will unlock new loci for vore. Otherwise, they can only be added through the potions.

Settings.Name: Require Proper Anatomy
Settings.Description: If true, special types of vore will require you to have a body part that would enable that type of vore.

Settings.Name: Switch Lethal to Endo
Settings.Description:
You are able to stop digesting prey with Toggle Lethal spell or by Endoing another prey.
If this is off, you will only be able to switch back to endo if no prey are being digested in this locus.

Settings.Name: Slow Swallowing
Settings.Description: Succecssfully "swallowing" a creature requires 2 actions, not 1. (WIP)

Settings.Name: Detach prey
Settings.Description: Prey will be detached from the world grid when swallowed. This means they will be unaffected by AoEs and surfaces, but unable to cast shout spells.

Settings.Name: Indigestion Limit
Settings.Description: Number of levels of "Indigestion" at which a pred will be forced to regurgitate all of their prey. Set to 0 to disable.

Settings.Name: Exhaustion Limit
Settings.Description: Number of levels of "Exhaustion" at which a prey will be exhausted and stop struggling. Set to 0 to disable. (WIP)

Settings.Name: Indigestion is removed only on rest
Settings.Description:
Instead of being removed when there is no living prey inside of a pred, indigestion will ONLY be removed on long rest.
Use with high indigestion limit.

Settings.Name: Max Predator Chance (Medium)
Settings.Description: Limits the probability of a medium creature being chosen as a pred to this value. Set to 100 or higher to disable.

Settings.Name: Max Predator Chance (Small)
Settings.Description: Limits the probability of a small creature being chosen as a pred to this value. Set to 100 or higher to disable.

Settings.Name: Max Predator Chance (Tiny)
Settings.Description: Limits the probability of a tiny creature being chosen as a pred to this value. Set to 100 or higher to disable.

Settings.Name: Maximum Swallow Cooldown
Settings.Description: Maximum cooldown between NPC vore attempts (in turns).

Settings.Name: Minimum Swallow Cooldown
Settings.Description: Minimum cooldown between NPC vore attempts (in turns).

Settings.Name: Predator Chance (Monster)
Settings.Description:
The % of a monster becoming a predator. Monsters are any creature that isn't internally considered Male or Female.
This value is multiplied by the race's multiplier. Set to 0 to disable.

Settings.Name: Predator Chance (Female)
Settings.Description:
The % of a female NPC becoming a predator. Female NPCs have Body Types 1 or 2, with some exceptions.
This value is multiplied by the race's multiplier. Set to 0 to disable.

Settings.Name: Predator Chance (Male)
Settings.Description:
The % of a male NPC becoming a predator. Male NPCs have Body Types 3 or 4, with some exceptions.
This value is multiplied by the race's multiplier. Set to 0 to disable.

Settings.Name: Reset Race Config
Settings.Description:
RaceConfig.json is located in 'AppData\Local\Larian Studios\Baldur's Gate 3\Script Extender'
Race Config stores the % of an NPC of every race becoming a pred.
The final chance is 'Race Probability * Sex Probability / 100'%
This Resets RaceConfig.json to 100 for every race.

Settings.Name: Load Example Race Config
Settings.Description:
This loads an example race config.
Use this if you're too lazy to customize the probabilities yourself, or as a starting point
Back up you RaceConfig.json, because this will overwrite it!

Settings.Name: Reload Race Config
Settings.Description:
Reloads the RaceConfig from the currently saved RaceConfig.json (if it exists)
Normally it's loaded when you load a save, but this option allows you to manually reload it.

Settings.Name: Regurgitation Cooldown
Settings.Description: Preds are unable to regurgitate prey for a number of turn after regurgitation. Set to 0 to disable

Settings.Name: Swallow Cooldown
Settings.Description: Preds are unable to swallow prey for a number of turn after regurgitation. Set to 0 to disable

Settings.Name: Regurgitation Distance
Settings.Description: Determines how far prey spawn when regurgitated.

Settings.Name: Belly Scale
Settings.Description: Increases / reduces the size of all bellies. Default is 100%

Settings.Name: Update Belly Visuals
Settings.Description: Immediately update belly visuals

Settings.Name: Gurgle Probability
Settings.Description: The % chance of a gurgle being played every 6 seconds (a turn). Set to 0 to disable.

Settings.Name: Enable Debug Options
Settings.Description: Access debug options. Do not check this unless you know what you're doing.

Settings.Name: Reset Vore
Settings.Description:
Check this to reset vore. All preds will regurgitate everything and the stored data will be cleared. Wait until it's ready before clicking again.
If it's not switching back to Ready after 2-3 seconds, check Console for errors.

Settings.Name: Always Succeed Vore
Settings.Description: If true, all vore attempts will result in a success.

Settings.Name: Locks Stomach Item
Settings.Description: Locks 'stomach item' that is used to store items during item vore.

Settings.Name: Teleport Prey
Settings.Description: Determines if a living prey is teleported to their predator at the end of each turn (or every 6 seconds outside of turn-based mode). By default is on, should be only turned off in case of performance issues

Settings.Name: Print Vore Data
Settings.Description: Prints VoreData to the console

Settings.Name: Shows WIP functionality
Settings.Description: Shows a tab with some WIP options. Most of them work just fine, but use them at your own risk.

Settings.Name: Item Vore
Settings.Description:
Enables you to swallow items. They will be stored inside a locked container in your inventory.
Items can be digested is your stomach start digesting prey. Digested items are permanently lost!

Settings.Name: Item Digestion
Settings.Description:
When you start digesting prey, the items in your stomach might be digested.
WARNING: THIS WILL DELETE STORY ITEMS IN YOUR STOMACH AND COULD SOFTLOCK YOUR SAVE

Settings.Name: Weight Gain
Settings.Description:
Stores and adds fat value to belly size. Fat is increased during digestion of dead prey and reduced upon resting.
This is here, because it ONLY affects the belly size, so some people found it confusing.

Settings.Name: Weight Gain Rate
Settings.Description: % of a prey's weight you gain as fat.

Settings.Name: Weight Loss Amount (Long Rest)
Settings.Description: How much fat a character loses on long resting.

Settings.Name: Weight Loss Amount (Short Rest)
Settings.Description: How much fat a character loses on short resting.

Settings.Name: Hunger uses fat
Settings.Description: If set to true, fat will be used to reduce hunger gain by half, if you don't have enough satiation stacks.

Settings.Name: Sweaty Vore
Settings.Description: Swallowing a prey will make the predator sweaty for a couple of turns. IDK why this has been removed from the main options.

Settings.Name: Loci with bonuses
Settings.Description: These loci will receive bonuses from feats (like prey being able to cast spells while inside this locus)

Settings.Name: I have read the wiki
Settings.Description: By checking this, you assert that you have read any and all information available on the wiki.
